alert.note: Alert for Clark; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 2:43PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Clark and Taylor Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 242 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ladysmith to 10 miles north of Fairchild. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Greenwood around 300 PM CDT. Loyal and Jump River around 305 PM CDT. Chelsea and Westboro around 335 PM CDT. Rib Lake around 340 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Highway 73 And 98, Polley, The Mondeaux Flowage, Atwood, Tioga, Christie, Perkinstown, Highway M And Joe Martin Road, Esadore Lake and Eidsvold. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
